title: Technonatural Futures
description: A speculative video essay exploring three defining phenomena of our generation: technological creation, environmental destruction, and the extinction of experience.

info.summary: What does it mean to coexist with technology and nature in an era marked by rapid change? Technonatural Futures unfolds its narrative through a technological garden—an exploration of our relationship with the natural world, juxtaposed with found footage that invites reflection on our interconnected existence.
full: In Technonatural Futures, the relationship between humanity, nature, and technology is brought into sharp focus. The visual centrepiece of the project is a technological garden composed of evolving flowers, generated by a generative adversarial network (GAN) trained on internet-sourced images. The GAN produces endless iterations of artificial flora—demonstrating both the creative possibilities and the ethical dilemmas of machine learning. Although these digital flowers are derived from real ones, they lack the tangible qualities of living plants, highlighting a potential future where technology supplants nature in unsettling ways.

By intertwining technological creations with natural motifs, Technonatural Futures explores the power and peril of innovation. The video essay serves not only as a meditation on the cost of progress but also as a call to reimagine the future. Found footage is used throughout to contextualise these ideas within the broader narrative of human history. The merging of natural and digital realms through visual storytelling becomes a reflection of modern existence, where the technological world cannot replace the physical one but must find ways to coexist with it. Ultimately, Technonatural Futures challenges us to consider not only what technology can achieve, but also the profound implications of those achievements.
